intro: Hexaneurocarpon brilletii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, often hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a short, thick stem and compact foliage. The plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
